pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser
Class BXMLBrowser

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.pivot.wtk.Component
      org.apache.pivot.wtk.Container
          org.apache.pivot.wtk.Window
              org.apache.pivot.wtk.Frame
                  pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser.BXMLBrowser
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<org.apache.pivot.wtk.Component>, org.apache.pivot.beans.Bindable, org.apache.pivot.collections.Sequence<org.apache.pivot.wtk.Component>, org.apache.pivot.util.Filter<java.io.File>, org.apache.pivot.wtk.ButtonPressListener, org.apache.pivot.wtk.ComponentKeyListener, org.apache.pivot.wtk.ConstrainedVisual, org.apache.pivot.wtk.FileBrowserListener, org.apache.pivot.wtk.Visual
public class BXMLBrowser
extends org.apache.pivot.wtk.Frame
implements org.apache.pivot.beans.Bindable, org.apache.pivot.wtk.FileBrowserListener, org.apache.pivot.util.Filter<java.io.File>, org.apache.pivot.wtk.ButtonPressListener, org.apache.pivot.wtk.ComponentKeyListener

Frame that allows selecting .bxml files below the current directory and instantiating their contents via a BXMLLoaderButton.
.bxml files containing a Window (or any subclass including Sheets) as root element are instantiated "as are" and opened in front of this Window. Other root components are opened as content and in front of a newly created Window. This allows testing of .bxml files that can not be started with the Pivot Eclipse Plugin.

You can use this Tool easiest in Eclipse if you have the Pivot Eclipse Plugin installed. In this case, you just

  1. run the script file BXMLBrowser.bxml as Pivot Script, which creates a run configuration.
  2. You can assign this (or a copy thereof) to the project containing the .bxml file(s) to be tested.
  3. All that remains is to add the directory or jar containing the package pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser
    4. to the classpath of that project
You can use and reuse the created run configuration(s) for testing all .bxml files inside the corresponding project(s).

Note that if you use this class in the way described, classes used inside the .bxml file are not reloaded. If you want your own classes to be reloaded with each loading of the .bxml file, use BXMLBrowserApp instead!

Author:
Katharina Wegener and Thomas Guretzki
